channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The passage from the integral to the rational group ring in algebraic $K$-theory
item.description: arXiv:2110.01413v5 Announce Type: replace Abstract: An open question is whether the map $\widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Z} G \rightarrow \widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Q} G$ in reduced $K$-theory from the integral to the rational group ring is trivial for any group $G$. We will show that this is false, with a counterexample given by the group $QD_{32} *_{Q_{16}} QD_{32}$. We will also show how to compute the image of the map $\widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Z} G \rightarrow \widetilde{K_0 }\mathbb{Q} G$ using representation theoretic means, assuming $G$ satisfies the Farrell-Jones conjecture.
item.dc:creator: Georg Lehner
